page.title: 02AGE OF NORTH CAVE CHURCH
page.content:
The real age of our church is not known but we do know that the first Rector worked there in 1175 so the time the church was built must be some time near that. The best guess at the age of the church is 900 years' old. The style of the windows is also around that time.
The Normans were the people who built the first part of the church. This church was not as big as the one you see today. When the Normans built the church, the tower was very much shorter, the roof was lower and the hall was not as wide. Since then the church has been made bigger and a clock, porch and pinnacles have been added.
